ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A good and necessary introduction to CP. A first attempt within the department to see how you handle presenting relatively unfamiliar material for the first time. If CP is one of your exam subfields, it makes sense to take this class.
Introduction to some of the main areas of work in Comp. Politics.

A graduate-level course that introduces major themes and debates in comparative politics with a focus on research design. Would highly recommend this course to any student interested in developing research skills in comparative politics.

The class provides a helpful overview to the substantive questions asked by the comparative politics subfield. I would recommend the course to another student looking to get familiar with the subfield.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This material was almost entirely new to me and it was useful to have the chance to read it.
This course is helpful in preparing for the Comparative Politics field exam. The final paper gave me the chance to explore major texts in my specific topic of interest.
